Eve had overstated the words of God's command. He had said to Adam and Eve, “But of the tree of the knowledge of good and evil thou shalt not eat of it, for in the day thou eatest thereof thou shalt surely die.” In Eve's controversy with the serpent, she added the clause, ”Neither shall ye touch it, lest ye die.” Here the
55
subtlety of the serpent was seen. This statement of Eve gave him advantage.—RH Feb. 24, 1874.
